website_summaries.verdict: With adjustable speed and operating positions, this machine is versatile enough to handle any small carpet-drying task.
pros: Reliable machine that holds up well over time
cons: It doesn't put out enough airflow to tackle large tasks

customer_reviews.title: Vary' nice ;)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago, and have used it about a dozen times...this is one nice machine! It is a perfect size for a small shop or home use. I love being able to plug things INTO IT - it's like having a power strip built in. Arrived on time as I remember, and no issues with the seller. Contemplating getting another, I'm that happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: John Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: Great little fan - used a couple times to dry up the garage floor when both cars were wet after a rain. Also used to defrost the freezer of an older model shorty refrigerator that was frozen up - set the fan at high speed, and put it in the center sitting position so it blew on the ice and less than an hour the job was done. Very light weight and can be tucked away easily - I'm sure it will get lots of work this winter when the snow and slush fall off the cars. Will use to move along the drying next time I clean the carpets also.
customer_reviews.author: PamelaJane

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Indeed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this on jobsites for a few months now and am thrilled with it. It is a bit noisy on the higher setting but that's to be expected considering how much air it moves. Make sure you sweep up before turning this bad boy on. Works great for getting drywall mud/paint to dry faster, or airing out wet areas whether from a roof leak or plumbing. I've also used it to keep air moving in stifling hot attics/garages/unfinished rooms. It's worth twice what I paid for it
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is a good fan. I've been running it pretty much continuously ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good fan. I've been running it pretty much continuously for a year with no problems. Yesterday I took it apart to clean the blades. Couldn't get the squirrel cage off for a thorough cleaning, but I did manage to do an adequate cleaning job with a toothbrush. This fan moves a good amount of air with not too much noise. However, gosh sakes, buy it anywhere but Amazon. At least read up on Jeff Bezos before deciding if you want to do business with him.
customer_reviews.author: CCornelius

customer_reviews.title: I have been happy with the results and would recommend them with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to help dry my basement (old house in western Washington); if we have prolonged, heavy rain water finds its way through our foundation. Not a lot of water, but enough to make the floor wet. These move a lot of air and they move it how it needs to be moved- across the floor to evaporate water. Smaller in size than I had imagined. You can "gang" multiple blowers together. I have been happy with the results and would recommend them with the caveat that I've only owned them a couple of months and long term reliability hasn't been proven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I very much liked the fan, though it's a little too soon to judge the durability. The price was very good, the size worked very well for me. Though some may desire more power, it was sufficient for me, and noise might be an issue if it were more powerful. Overall, very satisfied, and I'm thinking about buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: bud

customer_reviews.title: The price alone should move you
customer_reviews.text: Recent price drop made this a steal. You can't possibly find a squirrel cage floor blower anywhere near this price. -It's made by a respected and reputable manufacturer "Shop-Air" by Shop-Vac -The fan is only rated 500 CFM but is sufficient for home use. -You can position the fan in three directions flat, 45 and 90. -Built in extension outlets are handy and power cord is long. Reasonably quiet and a great value, you will quickly realize many uses for this fan and wonder why you haven't had one till now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. MomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air mover about 1.5 years ago and it's still going strong! I smoke cigarettes and was sick of going outside in the cold/heat to smoke, so I hooked this air mover up to some flexible ducting so the smoke can be vented out of the hole for my dryer exhaust. It's strong enough that I can feel the air coming outside about 50ft from where the air mover is placed. It has been on for about 6-8 hours per day every day since I bought it and still works like new (even though it's been dropped a few times). I'm very impressed by the quality of this air mover!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Tiny powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet. I had to check it was actually running!! I have a stone basement in a hundred year old house and moisture comes up through the floor. This along with the dehumidifier really keep things at bay ( unless there’s super heavy rainfall that nothing could keep up with) It just runs 24-7 and I never hear it (even when I’m in the basement)
customer_reviews.author: jennifer mcd

customer_reviews.title: Good value/budget buy for light duty, quiet and well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Good vac for light use around our home. Use it for drying carpet after steam cleaning it, or for drying out our wall after a minor water leak. It's not pushing a whole lot of air, less than you'd think for its CFM rating, but it's pretty good for the money. Construction seems solid. It's relatively quiet even at full speed. Good budget/value buy.
customer_reviews.author: freethinker

customer_reviews.title: Been running nearly 2 years without being cut off.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to keep in my boat during storage, this fan runs constantly the only time i cut it off is when i am using the boat. Most recently i have not used the boat in about 6 months and the fan has been running nonstop with no issues. I only put 40 hours on my boat in 2 years so other than that this fan has been running constantly with no issues. Very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It’s not what you see in a store’s entrance
customer_reviews.text: Well built, solid. OK noise - louder than anticipated given others “quiet” review. My beef: it pushes air in such a narrow dimension, doesn’t make sense for circulating within a room. Aka good for a targeted area, not for a whole room freshly painted. Mixed feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Neptune

customer_reviews.title: easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to operate, and moves plenty of air. Fairly quiet, but vibrated/rattled a bit more than a similar Craftsman model when placed on a concrete floor. Very spartan design (no rubber "soft grip" areas, for example) but functional. I liked that the hand grip is positioned for easy changes in orientation and easy carry. The two outlets are a bonus for daisy chaining multiple units.
customer_reviews.author: mahalo

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: I went to three different "harbor freight" type stores and couldn't find a fan with this CFM inside of a package this small. The closest I could find was too long for the space I wanted to store it in my van, and was about the same price. That one had almost no warranty and was a name brand I have never heard of. I am happy with this one. I am considering a second to keep at home.
customer_reviews.author: steve d

customer_reviews.title: Mini Air Mover saved me $$$
customer_reviews.text: When I took the Mini Air Mover out of the box, I was sure it was a waste of money. Plugged it in and was so quiet I didn't think it could be powerful enough to dry the wet carpet and pad (plumbing leak) in the basement. I WAS WRONG! This little fan completely dried out Berber carpet and pad in a few days. Even the dog loves how it blows air at floor level.
customer_reviews.author: DJF

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a nice work fan. I use two or three of these guys to move air on interiors of job sites while construction is going. They work great, and are pretty durable. I have been using 4 of them off and on for a year with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Space Fans.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan at the same time I bought my carpet cleaner. It works great for drying the carpets, but it has also been an incredible alternative to my space fans. There is more power in this little fan than in any of my other fans, and it circulates the air in the room much better. I won't go back to anything else, including box fans.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Great little blower
customer_reviews.text: Great little blower. I'm a flooring installer and install a lot of glue-down sheet vinyl, kitchen and bathroom floor installations. This little unit is perfect for smaller areas where my big "flood-fan" is just too big and bulky. It is small enough to fit in tighter areas and plenty strong enough to dry the glue quickly so I can get on with it. Way quieter than my big fan too... no more having to shout to communicate with helper or customer. Will probably order a second unit, since they can be daisy chained, having additional outlets in the housing (like an extension cord) for other tools or another blower.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was very pleased with this fan. It was quiet and moved a lot of air. Over the last 6 month, the fan became more and more noisy. Rather than throw it out, I decided to see if I could bring it back to life. When I tore the motor apart I found that the bearings were shot. They were totally dry. I lubed them and reassembled the fan. It sounds better but I don't expect it will last much longer. I know it is a cheap fan but you should be able to get more than a few months of service from am item like this.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful air mover with a convenient built in outlet. My big window (24,500 BTU) air conditioner went out and I did not want to spend the money to replace it so I bought this and used a Vornado fan and moved the cool air from a bedroom small air conditioner (5000 BTU) and another bedroom small air conditioner (5000 BTU) down a long hallway and cooled my whole 1250 square foot poorly insulated house. Not only did I save the major price ($550-$600 or more) on an air conditioner but also saving a lot on my electric bill. I plan on doing the same with a 230 volt space heater in the wintertime.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kimbrell

customer_reviews.title: a little wobbly and smaller than i expected but...
customer_reviews.text: overall this is a great, somewhat compact air mover. in my unit, the wobble is caused by the fan being off-axis along the motor's shaft. this make the fan to hit the sides, especially when on high speed. it's not a big enough deal for me to care about as i only use this fan in a shower room for less than 15 minutes at a time. it's smaller than i thought. i used to have another small blower with lesser specs. that one was several inches taller and rotated around a fixed base. this fan, without that feature, feels much tighter/solid. prefer it this way!
customer_reviews.author: pog

customer_reviews.title: Saved me thousands!
customer_reviews.text: Although this little blower doesn't seem to blow any harder than a good fan, the way it's shaped to blow across the floor really makes it work to help dry up wet carpet (or painted walls, or under the sink, etc.). Along with a dehumidifier, this product helped to save me thousands of dollars on a flooded basement. It will definitely stay in my homeowners arsenal of necessary products to own!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: They worked well for the price. If you're having floors done or an interior paint job done, or if you just spill stuff a lot, they're worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Dries out my basement anytime I have water issues. Also use it to cool me off when I Dj in hot venues. Plan on buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Vanager

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This air mover is just what I was looking for. Helps push out hot engine air in my garage with quiet efficiency. For the price it works great. I didn't need a industrial size unit. Also it's from Shop Vac, so I'm confused in its reliability and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing air flow, and pretty quite. I use mine inside and outside, works great. I sleep with a fan year round, and if you are looking at this one, curious if it produces enough noise to sleep with..... it doesn't for me, too quite.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment for my Business!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to use during my DJ gigs and it is a lifesaver!!! I ran this fan for the first time DURING a Wedding Ceremony on low behind my table and I could hear everything even with it blowing directly on me. Once the party got started I kicked it up on high and it ran flawlessly all night!! I will be purchasing 2 more of these!!
customer_reviews.author: Kendal Hadaway

customer_reviews.title: Seriously moves lots of air
customer_reviews.text: Husband was looking for something to replace a fan at work for various uses. He loves this unit. Moves lots of air. And quiet on low setting!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Good (not great) little fan
customer_reviews.text: I knew that this was going to be smaller than most. That is what I wanted. I hoped that it would move more air. It blows, but I don't think it outperforms a smaller fan that we have. I certainly have uses for this unit, but I don't think I'll buy another. Good for what it is. Good if you are aware of what you are buying
customer_reviews.author: Agent86ish

customer_reviews.title: I really could have gotten away with one but I'm still glad i got two
customer_reviews.text: I had a big round fan on the patio that was very loud and we could not use on high because having a conversation was impossible. I bought two of these and have them both on high facing different directions and combined they are a lot quieter than the big fan on low. I do not need to lift them off the ground the air hits us perfectly. I really could have gotten away with one but I'm still glad i got two.
customer_reviews.author: Papi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for keeping the garage cool
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan. I admittedly don't use it for it's intended purpose but it still has worked great. I use it when I'm working in the garage and with the Virginia humidity in the summer, this product does a great job of keeping me cool. The extra plug ins are a nice feature as well because my garage has lifted power plugs. I e ran this product for many hours without any issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Nice fans found better ones for just a little more money 💰 so only have two of these. Work great 👍 not as powerful as others
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Love mine... I bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: I would give these 100 stars!! I love them so much. It’s been hot and these babies blow so nice it makes it livable! Plus they are great for construction projects too.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: This product is fantastic! Really moves air
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic! Really moves air, very powerful. looks and feels very durable. Can't beat the price. If you have a flooded basement, are doing a lot of painting or drywalling, if you are finishing a floor, this is a great little item to have around. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: kiwi24

customer_reviews.title: Very well made i much prefured this over lasko or air king.
customer_reviews.text: Much better the the Stanley ,lasko ,air king fans. Those are toys compared to this little guy. Has nice weight to size ratio and feels well made and durable unlike the lasko I bought first. The way this fan feels and how well its made I will give the actual shop vac brand a try now I'm very pleased with the quality of this product and my next shop vac will be from this company now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This blower works great. I use it in the automotive repair business for drying out wet carpet and it works as good as the more expensive brand that we also have. It doesn't have that rubber type exterior shell that the more expensive brands do so if you drop it there may be some damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard-working and dependable product. We got 3 of these now - one in the kiln room for clearing carbonized wax clouds, one by virtual reality workstation to blow on a giant array of video cards, and one to air out smelly carpets when the roof leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Valeriy N.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I own a marina that floods alot! These are a great deal and dry the floors fast for their size! Make great fans in the summer also!
customer_reviews.author: Christian E. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Great small air mover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small air mover. Nothing too fancy, but works quietly and efficiently. I own a cleaning company and have bought 3 of them for drying the floors in accounts that have constant foot traffic as well as drink spills. It works best for areas about 10' x 20' point it at a 45 degree angle to a wall so you get a nice cross flow.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great air flow and low noise level.
customer_reviews.text: Great. Air flow. Noise level on low or medium is quite low. Moves a lot of air at every setting.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard A.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely good for directing air at baseboards for drying after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints, this performs as expected. It moves a ton of air for its size and does so fairly efficiently. It pulls about 50 watts on I, 65 on II and 90 on III. It's not quiet, but it's not annoyingly loud. Definitely good for directing air at baseboards for drying after a flood or for any reason when you want air directed in a smaller area than a typical fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kelliar

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Compact. Nice yellow. Three level and blows well. As described. We may like this more than our in home AC
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 Years.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan the month of OCTOBER 2013 and it lasted 6 YEARS as a make up fan on top of my pellet stove.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Worked great initially then started moving across floor when on then ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially then started moving across floor when on then at just 13 months it died.Sparking,almost caught my house on fire
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: surpassed expectations
customer_reviews.text: for what it is described it works great. there's no heat function but it is still effective after using my rug dr. It only took about 10 minutes per direction of the blower to dry 15 ft long by 2.5 ft wide sections of the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca 4*

customer_reviews.title: Great little fan
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream. I use the fan in my bedroom at night for a little extra airflow. I've also used it in the garage while I was reorganizing... it pushed just enough air to keep me comfortable in a Florida garage in summer.
customer_reviews.author: dpagemom

customer_reviews.title: Quiet machine with lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Got this to cool off a compressor and very surprised with how light and powerful it is. Quieter than expected too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to dry my basement out after a recent flood/leak episode and to use at rental properties/etc. Pros: you can lean it back and make it blow up at a 30 degree angle and it's got 2 slots for power hookups (basically an outlet on the unit) Cons: I was not impressed by how much air it put out, nor the distance that the air shot out. 500 CFM's seemed more than what it really was.
customer_reviews.author: N8

customer_reviews.title: Great blower.
customer_reviews.text: This fan is a power house. Puts out a ton of air for it's size. Been using it to help dry the carpets after steam cleaning and it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to keep cool during gigs outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Musician here. Bought this to keep cool during gigs outdoors. I live in the Southeast, and the summer here is horrendous. Works well keeping the air-flow and doesn't make too much noise. My only issue is it's pretty damn yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great value and does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: We recently had a bad water leak in our basement, this is doing a much better job of drying out the cement floor than the conventional fans we were using. Also, much better price than the Stanley/Lasko fans that are pretty much the same thing, and were all we could find locally. Fast shipping in two days helped a lot too!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty
customer_reviews.text: What a great blower. I purchased a pair of them. I have used them in the basement to help dry up moisture from the rain we got in the beginning of the summer. I have also used them to circulate the air conditioned air on the second floor of our cape code home. It does a great job. Prior to purchasing the pair of Mighty Mini Air Movers, we only had box fans to rely on which were not very effective. Five stars to Shop-Vac for their product and five stars to amazon for getting to me so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F

customer_reviews.title: It’s very small with weak air flow.
customer_reviews.text: While it is pretty lightweight, the air is so weak it takes forever to dry the floor. I use it to blow dry floors after I wash them. Not worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lin

customer_reviews.title: High air flow - not too loud - works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product for the price and size! Really moves air! We were having trouble in our older rental with the A/C not blowing on one side of the house and the landlord would not fix. This sure solved the issue! It's no louder than a free standing fan and the air it blows feels cool.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Jean

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and still going
customer_reviews.text: We bought these almost 2 years ago, they still work just a good as day one! They get used daily for long periods of time and we’ve never had trouble with them, really powerful for the size , the extra plug ins built into them are handy to
customer_reviews.author: lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Works great great but doesn't take up too much space
customer_reviews.text: Works great great but doesn't take up too much space. We got it after our dishwasher overflowed and leaked into the basement. Dried it out so it didn't mold.
customer_reviews.author: TYFIGHTER

customer_reviews.title: Blows lots of air!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for blowing a lot of air and keeping areas cool or drying a wet floor. Too noisy to sleep with but quiet enough to work around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best fan I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: The best fan I have ever purchased. This thing is rock solid, the build quality is impeccable the cord is long and beefy 3 speeds range from quiet gusts to hurricane. Great for home ventilation in the hot summer able to move air all the way down a hallway with force.
customer_reviews.author: bob loblaw

customer_reviews.title: bought to help circulate the pellet stove heat around the house. Not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of air this throws it is remarkably quiet. I wish I would have bought one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Expert #1

customer_reviews.title: Used it as a shop fan for my welding station ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it as a shop fan for my welding station and it was a little beast. The thing was filled with metal dust and had sparks hit it all day everyday and kept working non stop. Still use it today.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Graham

customer_reviews.title: It really blows.....fan pun!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help me dry out my basement after some recent rainstorms. The fun is rugged and feels solid and has outlets on it as well so you can daisy chain other fans to it. On full blast it is not noticeable for me when I'm upstairs which is a plus. The low setting is pretty week but it's a 400 CFM fan so I imagine on low it's not really moving too much air anyhow. On medium and high it really cranks and I have a dry floor now.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Not as well as a professional version of the same but great for homeowner type stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to dry out the carpet in my boat after a winter leak. It performed very well. Not as well as a professional version of the same but great for homeowner type stuff. Excellent quality - very good price.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth w barnes

customer_reviews.title: This sucker Blows!!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE the heat, I HATE summer and don't have A/C. This was just what the Dr. ordered. I love it and don't know how, but it blows cold air and I mean BLOWS. I can't even use the high setting in the house and don't really need to. The size is perfect for winter storage as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A.

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as expected, but does well for the size
customer_reviews.text: I wish this moved more air. It gets the job of drying my floors done. I only wish it moved more air so I could use it to exhaust the house like my last fan could. Might need a more powerful fan for that task.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Feels heavy duty and runs well.
customer_reviews.text: Product feels like it is high quality. I've left it on for several days at a time after a leak in my basement and never had any problems. 8 would recommend this to a friend z
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Shop Vac Blower
customer_reviews.text: This unit was the answer when we had a water leak that flooded a room. After eliminating as much of the water as possible, we used this blower to help dry the carpet. Within a few hours, the job was completed. This blower has three speeds and is very quiet considering the amount of air it moves. Inexpensively priced, a nice find. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A.

customer_reviews.title: I recently bought 3 and they work great. Also
customer_reviews.text: Moves a surprising amount of air for its size. Compared to full size fans it is much smaller/ lighter/ easier to move. If you need to dry carpets quickly use a full size fan, not this. We leave them overnight to dry carpets after shampooing in bedrooms of occupied rooming houses where we do not want lots of noise or to leave a $ 300 fan unsecured. I recently bought 3 and they work great. Also, used during our most recent remodel to help speed up the drying during drywall installation.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Fan
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice fans. We have used them for months now and they run as they did from the start. They do make some noise, but fans do that when they push air. These fans push a lot of air and work well. One nice thing is that they have an outlet for daisy-chain of additional fans or other 120V items.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: People try to steal it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy. It works great and is fairly quiet. It's portable and yet industrial. I haul it around with me to bbq's, parties, etc. The only problem I have with it is that everyone wants to steal it from me.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Ray

customer_reviews.title: Small, powerful, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Professional drummer who needed a small yet powerful fan for this past summer's outdoor gigs. Flawless performance. Banged around with equipment in van on a 4 week tour thru the Midwest, Texas, Oklahoma. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Spiridigliozzi

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as an exhaust fan while painting and works well. Moves a lot of air for its size. Having outlets on the unit makes life easy to not have extension chords all over. For the price i doubt you can find a better name brand product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the deal for big power at a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high velocity air flow for a deal at its finest. It blows super strong, and I will probably buy another. If any products need tested, id gladly accept the chance to review more or other products.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, quiet with good power
customer_reviews.text: Compact, light weight, and quiet blower fan. The only thing you hear is the sound of air, not the motor. It also has 2 positions, you just rotate the unit so it can blow horizontally or at approximately 30 degrees. This unit is fairly powerful, but if you need a lot of air moving you'll need something more potent. For my needs it works.
customer_reviews.author: LLF

customer_reviews.title: ... a air mover for "small" rooms this thing works great. going to buy another
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a air mover for "small" rooms this thing works great. going to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: fd781

customer_reviews.title: High-quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product a must have works great High-quality great to dry floors great for spills get it great price
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rose

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shop vac fan. I use it all the time at work. Moves alot more air than I thought it would. 5 stars 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Critic

customer_reviews.title: Best Air Mover Ever
customer_reviews.text: This blower delivers more air than a bulky 20 inch fan and puts the air right where you want it. Runs very quiet on low or medium setting. Lightweight, easy to position. Will sit flat like in the picture and tilts back to 45 degrees, stable in both positions. The cord is heavy duty, probably #14 wire instead of the usual #16. Soak the cord in hot water to straighten out the bends. Molded 3 prong plug. Best value in portable cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F

customer_reviews.title: one of the best purchases ever made
customer_reviews.text: one of the best purchases ever made! We had a flood in our basement and really helped drying out the floors.
customer_reviews.author: HD84

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value product. Only used once so can’t speak to durability yet but delivers exactly what it promises
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprising amount of air for such a small piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I had a water faucet break in my finished basement. It soaked about 100 square feet of carpet. I pulled up the carpet and places small wooden blocks every 5-10 feet to lift the carpet off the floor. I placed the fan in various positions and ran it non stop for over 4 days. It completely dried the carpet and the pad (which I originally intended to replace) and it still works. Renting from home depot was $25 a day (For a larger model).
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: I use this to dry my basement after the season flood that seems to happen each year. It blows the silly water leaks around the slab into my subpump and does it well and fast. It also drys carpet really well . I tested that on a runner from out side and man i got to say it works better than i could have imagined.
customer_reviews.author: SPB

customer_reviews.title: It does what it  is suppose to do.
customer_reviews.text: It normally takes 5-6 hrs. for the carpet to dry after I clean them. This machine actually had a room done in less than an hour to dry. So we did not have to wait until the next day for dry carpets. Well worth the cost of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Phoneman

customer_reviews.title: Best Shop-Air Around!
customer_reviews.text: That price is amazing. You can attach two other blowers to it and it is very powerful. Don't waste your money on any other brands for the money.
customer_reviews.author: tim c

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a Mighty Mini
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! I bought this because when it rains hard I sometimes get ground water in my floors & this has definitely dried it all up. Its small but does a big job
customer_reviews.author: Mom777

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mini
customer_reviews.text: A great little air mover, quiet and rugged. Cord wraps around carry handle for easy transport. Three speed motor to get the right amount of air flow in tight or smaller areas.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cocopelli

customer_reviews.title: Makes a GREAT air cleaner.....read how :-)
customer_reviews.text: I built a box out of 1/2 plywood to sit this in with open sides and a slot for the air flow. Then I put good 12x12 house filters over the sides and BAM a much better air cleaner for less than half the money of a hanging air cleaner for my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E.

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best buy for the price. We had some water damage and these saved us. The company that helped us dry down the house bought some as well. Not as powerful as their industrial fans, but very close! They use less power and less like to blow a circuit. Handy to have around and yes they do plug together.
customer_reviews.author: T (email me questions)

customer_reviews.title: especially the ones that don't like the force dryer to be used on them
customer_reviews.text: I use this blower to dry pet animals that come in for grooming appointments in a well ventilated cage. It's not too powerful but it does get the furry ones dry, especially the ones that don't like the force dryer to be used on them. The added plus is the extra outlets that you can use for other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Sashie-Washie

customer_reviews.title: ... having this Mini Air Mover and it still works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Over a year having this Mini Air Mover and it still works like a charm. The air mover is the right size for any room and does not take up as much room as the regular size air movers. It also has a powerful motor that gives out sufficient air. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: So far this dryer has worked well for me. I have a problem with a door that sometimes leaks. The dryer seems pretty well made and dries the carpet very quickly. Additional units can be connected for a larger area.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Was worried it would be cheap and not work well. I am glad I was wrong. Works great. Dried the wet carpets quick!
customer_reviews.author: Tim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact fan
customer_reviews.text: Great for drying the carpet after cleaning or drying the basement after flooding. For being small it has surprisingly good air movement. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheNanny

customer_reviews.title: it is mighty and mini
customer_reviews.text: It moves a lot of air-the first and second speed are pretty quiet-and it is pretty small.i really like it so far.the price was really good for the quality it seems.so far,so good. the only potential issue might be the plastic switch seems pretty light i'm careful with it because of that.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Compact yet reliable and quiet. This fan really moves air and dries up floors quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Shop vac air mover
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bang for your buck I had a lasko air mover it was the same size and configuration as the shop vac fan but weaker now for the only negative the thing is louder
customer_reviews.author: Biggy1812

customer_reviews.title: Top quality product
customer_reviews.text: The blower works quite well for it's size, though it is good for single room applications as far as drying a carpet that would take a long time to dry. It also works well as a drying aid to simply move the air, which helps in all applications, very good quality and a fair price, I use Amazon prime so two day shipping is no charge. Well worth having around.
customer_reviews.author: ScottS

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and durable. Great for a house fan.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the output of this fan. It pushes air very far across the room and is quiet compared to a classic house fan. If you use fans in your house, I would greatly recommend this to replace your box fans and stand up fans. It's made of a sturdy plastic and seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Dirks

customer_reviews.title: Great fan that moves more than enough air for drying ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fan that moves more than enough air for drying carpets or what have you. Decent volume of air and a decent pattern of dispersal. Does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Working great! 3 weeks running 24/7 so far under my house.... due to long term leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dunkel

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as described and in a timely manner. Much better for drying floors than a circular fan. So far, so good
customer_reviews.author: BEECEE

product_meta.title: Shop-Air by Shop-Vac 1032000 Mighty Mini Air Mover 3-Speed 3-Position Dryer for Wet Carpets, Floors, Walls & Ceilings, 500 CFM Motor
product_meta.description:
Air mover with a 500 max CFM features three different positions to direct airflow easily to wet carpets, floors, walls and ceilings. Onboard outlets allow you to connect multiple units together as well as a circuit breaker. Three-speed air control let you adjust the power of airflow to easily handle various tasks. Stackable design allows you to stack additional units for easy storage. 10' cord allows you to place the mover nearly anywhere in the room without requiring an extension cord.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Shop-Vac Mighty Mini Air Mover is designed to quickly dry wet carpets and floors, with second and third position for drying walls and ceilings. This unit has a three speed air flow control motor. Built in outlets to connect multiple units together. Units are stackable for easy storage. It has a 10-Foot power cord, carry handle for easy mobility, on board cord wraps and powerful 500 CFM motor
